About prestia.org

About the Site

This website is powered by the hacker-friendly static site generator jekyll and a custom template of my own invention called--quite creatively--kernel-theme. Hosting is provided by StableHost. Eye candy and graceful degradation are made possible by Bootstrap, jQuery, html5shim, hyphenator.â€‹js, and Pygments. All development takes place in TextMate and terminal. Posts are written in John Gruber's excellent markdown syntax, saved in plaintext, and interpreted by Rdiscount. Version control is powered by Git.

The source code for kernel-theme is available on GitHub and is totally free (as in speech and beer). I encourage anyone interested in working with jekyll give it a look. I would also like to thank Jekyll Bootstrap for laying much of the groundwork for kernel-theme and Kernel magazine for the inspiration.

Web Standards Statement

This blog adheres to modern web standards, but (against my better judgment) contains one validation error in order to help support users still running IE6. While I have done my best to ensure a comparable experience across browsers, I cannot guarantee that this blog will look or run flawlessly on noncompliant browsers. If you have trouble reading this blog in an older version of Internet Explorer, try downloading Chrome frame. If you still have a problem, you're probably out of luck.

Contact

I love hearing from readers, but purposefully exclude comments from this site. If you would like to contact me or comment on something you read here, please send me an email: prestia@shortmail.me

 

About

Anthony Prestia is an attorney & hacker living in Washington, DC. When he's not writing about himself in the third person, he's probably diving headfirst into a harebrained project that he knows too little about or having a drink at one of his favorite local spots.
